I recommend if you're looking for a cool vibe and upstairs dancing. And if you need food it's there just don't expect it to be great.
Jerk wings were fabulous!  Also had the strawberry, goat cheese and chicken salad... Also excellent!  Served in a stainless steel mixing bowl. HUGE! Definitely recommend!

Return? Not a destination spot but a good option if your in the area 
Atmosphere (3) - Standard bar vibe. Very busy when we were there
Food (3+) - french dip (3 - a little shy on roast beef, more bun), fries (4), Bloody Mary (4)
Service (3) Friendly
Cost = $58.24 after tax/before tip (included 2 other meals plus drinks)

This is probably my favorite restaurant in Shadyside. There is a huge menu with lots to choose from and whatever you pick is bound to be good. The French onion soup is to die for and they also broil cheese over their tomato soup. The staff is friendly and it's a nice atmosphere. I highly recommend stopping in for a drink and a bite if you're in the area.

Guys, this place will never leave your mind after coming here. I have only been here once, but it was just so comforting and memorable! First off, their fries are incredible - like some good ol' pub fries! So obviously a very important aspect. The prices aren't bad AT ALL in my opinion. The menu is different, but with familiar food! That's the best way I can explain it. I got the chicken Caesar wrap when I went (with fries, duh) and it was such a large portion and so delicious! I've been dying to stop here for brunch, or just really any other time, but I'm not super close by. Again, I've been here one time, but I can't stop thinking about how good it was!

The food is not good
Weekends are very crowded
So mediocre.

Shady Grove has been a great place for me and my co-workers to come enjoy a working lunch or a bottle of half-priced wine. Today I ordered a salad to-go and it was bountiful and delicious! The Waldorf Salad is so satisfying with juicy bites chicken, big walnuts, and granny smith apples. Definitely recommended for lunch, take-out or relaxing after a long day.

I normally don't order the same thing every time I go to a restaurant, but Shady Grove is the exception. The Autumn salad is delicious-- the toppings are plentiful and definitely make the salad memorable (unlike a lot of restaurants). There is a plethora of fantastic appetizers on the menu; in fact, the buffalo chicken dip is the only food that makes me occasionally regret going vegetarian (sorry, not sorry). My food has always been fresh and delicious here! 

The wait normally isn't that bad, but my only complaint is how FREEZING cold it is in the "waiting area". There isn't very much that they can do about this, unfortunately.
Excellent. Best salad I ever had. It's called the Summer Salad. It has shrimp and mango salsa. They also have steamed dumplings as an appetizer. Great food.

Shady grove has always been one of my favorite places to go in Pittsburgh especially when I'm down on Walnut st. Their buffalo chicken dip is so good along with their French fries and ranch. Yum! I am also a big fan of their Pittsburgh chicken salad as well as their chicken florentine wrap. My friends rave about their pizza since the crust is made with sweet dough.. So you get a hint of sweetness with every bite. I only had one bad experience here a few years ago. My food came out pretty cold.. However, I told our waitress and she brought back a whole new plate. Other than that, this is a place to check out!

Had a great dinner and drinks with coworkers after our shift (within easy walking distance from Shadyside Hospital). We shared the loaded latkes appetizer, which was delicious. For entrees, we ordered the fish tacos, a Caesar salad, and the Waldorf salad. The three tacos a single person can eat, but the salads come in large silver metal bowls and are really enough for two servings. All were delicious. There are large selective of beer and wine, as well as a few cocktails. I am finishing my excellent Wild Old Fashion as I type this. This place functions well as a restaurant-cum-bar.

Moving here from DC, maybe I just expect too much as far as service, but I feel like my expectations in this case are standard. 

Their food is delicious, there drinks are yummy, I have just been consistently disappointed by their service. Even if they are semi busy, the waitresses seem to be running around like chickens with their heads cut off. Though, the bartenders have their act together. 

I came here on Monday evening...around 6/630. I ordered the Fajita wrap...I took two bites, and then noticed there was a small brown hair in my fries. My hair is long and black, so clearly it wasn't mine. When I told the waitress, she very professionally exclaimed "shit!" and came over. 

I told her, I lost my appetite and just asked for a new order to go. I waited until my friend finished her meal, and then asked for the check. My waitress plopped mine down in front of me. Seriously? I ate human hair at your venue...and you're going to charge me for that? You've officially made my shit list.

For some reason, this place is always busy. I go here when I'm too tired to think of a place but still want to feel like I had lunch/dinner 'outside'. Large portions as is the norm, nice selection of drinks. I have tried a few burgers/sandwiches here (huge!).

Holy hot cocktailers batman!! And gangster rap any time after 8 pm. And two dollar beers and half priced margaritas on Thursdays. My service has always been prompt and friendly. The food is indeed mediocre but beer is pretty hard to screw up. It just has to be cold, which it is. God Bless I say!

Had the yak burger (excluded from the half-price burger offer on Mondays), and it was just okay - certainly not worth the $11 I'd paid for it.  The stuffed pepper soup was tasty and original, however, and the dinner salad was also decent.  Overall Shady Grove is respectable enough as a casual dining option, but there's nothing about it that would compel a return trip.

Food is solid, especially for a place whose main focus is on being a bar and a see-and-be-seen spot.  Pleasantly surprised by very good, prompt and friendly service.  

Wouldn't go here as a destination for a meal, but when you're on Walnut and aren't up for the usual bar fare or one of the more upscale places it's a good compromise with reliably decent to very good food.

This is a decent place to go for happy hour and I like the happy hour themes they have each day of the week.  My friends and I went for the Wednesday half off wine night and enjoyed a nice bottle of wine for cheap.  I also tried several of the appetizers and they were all tasty, good sized portions, and reasonably priced.  Nothing amazing, but all good.  Despite the place being packed the food came out quickly and the server was pretty attentive given how busy the place was.
One of my favorite places to go over in Shadyside. They a lot of different sandwiches and friendly staff. The chicken funguy sandwich is my go to! You have to try this play at sometime in your life.

Oh shady grove! I hadn't been here in ages, but was craving a solid salad and knew I couldn't go wrong here.  

There salads are HUGE and very filling.  I almost always get a pittsburgh salad (fake healthy), and shady grove does this well.  Waffle fries were delish, chicken was solid and their ranch is really good! 

This time around we got the surf and turf appetizer and it's not worth it.  Would not recommend this and docking a star for the inconsistency.

Drinks get an A+ for kind service adn great prices, the food ranks in at about a B/B-. I Had the ahi tuna for $9.. it was koay, and I give them props for having it on the menu as it's not typical bar food for Pittsburgh, but a very popular drinks accompaniment in Miami. If I return, I'll definitely go for the classic fried finger food. Had a few beers, each on draft for $1.42.. Awesome! The crowd filtered in for happy hour, and it was the most packed around 6. Overall, I'd do it again. Perhaps for a more formal seating in the upstairs restaurant, Walnut Grill. It seems to operate from the same kitchen and under the same management...  Since the great drink prices resonate as most memorable, I've added it to my "Party in the 'Burgh" list.

Arrived here for happy hour on a Tuesday. Specials - $3 drafts, $4 wines, and $6 mojitos from 5 to 7 pm. 

We ordered a few appetizers to share: chicken nachos ($11), mango salsa ($4) and grilled jerk shrimp ($5). The food was pretty good and a decent size. I especially loved the fresh jalapeños on the nachos and the convenience of the separate side cups of pico de gallo, sour cream and guacamole. The waitress was attentive and the noise level wasn't too bad. Unfortunately, my mojito was disappointing - very weak and fairly tasteless. 

Shady Grove is a good choice for a casual night out at a decent price. I'll be back to test out wine night - you can never go wrong with half price bottles (Wednesday and Friday).

Went to Shady Grove this afternoon and sat at the bar for a quick lunch.  It was anything but!  I originally went to order one of their "taters" - a loaded baked potato and the server told me, sorry we don't have them and that we are in the process of changing the menu.  Thanks...then I waited 25 minutes for her to bring my second choice.  The BBQ chicken wrap was okay as far as nourishment is concerned.  I wouldn't go back.  It looks like a cute cafe from the outside but its clear this place is a bar, serving bar food with bar service and bar atmosphere.

They have a fashionable, attractive people social scene going on most weekend nights.  I believe Friday is usually their biggest night, last Fri, they had a great DJ spinning electronica and house mixed in with your typical top 40 crap at the upstairs bar which also has a small dance floor.  If you're into the best scene, good looking people, and some risk of phoniness.  Drink prices are reasonable given the crowd they're shooting for.

I have only been to Shady Grove twice when I am in the area and don't feel like breaking the bank. 

Both times I have ordered one of their sandwiches, the first time being a caprese wrap and the last time a chicken florentine sandwich. The Chicken Florentine was definitely the better of the two, though honestly I have not had a caprese as a sandwich that I like anywhere.

My favorite thing about this place is the $2 Mexican beers and $4 tequila shots. The tequila shots are for any tequila of your choice! Last time we were there my boyfriend and I threw back a couple of Patron Silvers. We only stopped because we had to go shopping for house stuff (being an adult sucks sometimes!). I usually go with Dos Equis, either the Lager or Amber, as my drink of choice. Can't beat tasty $2 beers.

Atmosphere is nice bar/pub style with outside seating. Staff is friendly but service is slow. I had dinner there alone at 6pm on a weekday and it took them 30 min to bring the incorrect order then another 5 min to correct it. I am visiting this area, but where I come from a Medium burger means pink in the middle. My late arriving burger was burned on the outside and cooked all the way thru.  Sweet potato tots were sweet and tasty. Overall, just okay. Nothing special. Probably would not come here again.  Lots of great restaurants to try.
Generous portions, popular place, flavorful entrees, good wait staff, something on the menu for everyone

Decided to meet up with two friends here on Tuesday. We met at 6pm, which was perfect since it wasn't too busy yet (filled up by 7:30pm). We quickly had a table (opted for inside) and caught the second half of happy hour (5-7pm), which offered half price cocktails ($9-11 usually) and selected glasses of wine for $4. My two female friends were big fans of their Bellinis and I stuck with a Whiskey Mojito which was decent.

We started off with an appetizer of their dipsticks, which are pizza dough with spinach artichoke dip on top with ranch sauce for dipping. My friend has gotten them before and raved about them, however I thought they were just OK. Tuesday also brings the taco specials for $2. Last night's taco choices were either chicken or beef (I believe it changes each week). I stuck with chicken, which I thought were really good. Once we passed happy hour, we went with the Tuesday specials of $2 Mexican beers (Corona, XX, Pacifico). There were also $4 tequila shots, but we weren't going down that road.

Overall, I thought we got away with a great value and had a great time (about $15 each before tip for 3 hours). Our server Alex was great and I would definitely go back again.

Never had a bad meal at this place. The service is great and the food is always right. I've been to a few places around town that can screw up an order pretty easily, don't offer customization on items and the price doesn't match the quality; but this joint does not fall under any of those categories. Also, their To-Go section is on point. Highly recommend the sweet potato tots with their ranch dressing. It's fire.

To be honest I think I might just come back on weekends for drinks because they're food did not make me feel too great afterwards. It is normal bar food I suppose, but I was hoping for better quality. I ordered with my friend the pesto pizza and their new sandwich with spinach and chicken with aioli and cheese. I felt like i gained a few pounds, but the pizza was a little bland and the sandwich mainly just tasted like spinach. Their fries are crispy and taste pretty good along with their tater tots that I had on my first visit.

Been here a few times now and while it never disappoints, can't say that Shady Grove is anything tremendous. I will say that Happy Hour is a great time to grab some drinks here and maybe stop in for the daily food deal. My $5 tacos were definitely worth it! 

The beer selection is standard with a few craft beers on tap but mostly just your average Yuengling, Blue Moon and the sorts is what people go for.

I have enjoyed numerous experiences at Shady Grove. However, when I went there recently, it resulted in a horrible stomachache. I am not sure which of the dishes I got which were the thai shrimp tacos, summer salad, and The Goat pizza. I will not be going back anytime soon.

Service upstairs is horrible. My husband and I have been up there three times with the same server and we have nothing good to say except the food is decent, but only when they put your order in properly. Twice we've been there and explicitly stated we're vegan and our food has come out with cheese after asking for our food without. Also, our server was eating dinner at the bar in front of guests while our drinks were sitting empty for twenty minutes. From now on, we will only go to drink when already intoxicated...

I personally rarely come here specifically to eat. I do love to come here for the atmosphere/drinks/girls. Their waitresses are for the most part really hot!!!

The Food: personally I like the combo of onion soup and the shady burger (yea its not the best burger in town, but its got a great taste to it). Rest of their food is so-so, and some of it is down right awful, but again... i don't come here for the food.

The Atmosphere: LOVE the atmosphere!! There is outdoor seating, there are lots of windows, there is a jukebox upstairs, there is a fun bar area downstairs with lots of TV's so you can watch the game with buddies over some drinks. There are always very attractive people here.

Waitresses: really hot! really nice! great service!

This is def my favorite bar in shadyside, but again, I don't come here for the food! (except maybe the soup).
Tasty. Not out of this world, but always satisfying! Would recommend their pizzas to anyone though. Such a good dough!

Half portion of nachos available during happy hours, and still a huge plate. Grabbed their daily special last time, was a blue cheese buffalo hot dog (forgot the name). Very satisfying. Not 21 yet but will definitely return for half price cocktails this summer after my birthday.

If you're looking for a salad, prepare yourself to eat the whole garden. These veggie bowls are huge. 

I got the Pittsburgh salad complete with Waffle fries on my first visit. My second visit wasn't as healthy: Fried Green Tomatoes and the 'Shroom pizza. The tomatoes were spicey and super yummy, served on bed of mixed greens. 

Bread means a lot to me, so when this pizza aced the bread test, I was in love. The $11 dollars I paid for a small was more than worth it. 8 large slices that could have easily filled the tummies of three or more people. 

I also downed a couple of tequila sours with my meal. I have nothing but good things to say about every aspect of this place.

Sometimes I love this place, sometimes I cannot stand it. It depends on how busy they are and who is working. One time I had one of the best waitresses I've ever had. Another time I had a waitress I'm pretty sure was coked up. Meh. You never know.

The food, however, is always decent bar food. I really the shady sticks and the "pretzel." I like the appetizers in general. I love their bloody marys. Good burgers. Large salads. Lots of add-on options for any sandwich, salad, burger, etc.

Over-priced cocktails, but decent specials. Good beer choice usually. All in all, it's a decent place. I take friends here who are visiting from elsewhere because it's close to my apartment and had something to offer everyone.

Some places you just go to for the outdoor seating. 

As a vegan you have to take the good with the bad. Not that this place is "bad" per se, but there are few options. And very few that are healthy at that. 

Service was friendly and pretty quick - the bottled beer my husband chose was expired by a few months - whoops!

Great, quick-ish, place to meet up with friends after work on a nice day out and midweek there was a lot of outdoor seating to choose from. 

Typical "hummus & dip type offerings for the vegan lot.

Typical bar food. Good burgers. 

It gets extremely crowded on Wednesday evenings for half-price wine night. Be wary. If you're going for food on a Wed, show up by 6:30. Otherwise you'll never get a table.

Went here for dinner with my sister 2 weekends ago and it absolutely hit the spot! The menu has so many incredible options I could not decide, but finally went with the Chicken Florentine Sandwich and it was absolutely perfect! I opted for the sweet potato tots which were very good but maybe not as great as the hype led them to be. Still the service was excellent and my sandwich tasted as great as it sounded and was a terrific portion.

One word: AMAZING! Shady Grove did not disappoint with the happy hour specials today. Our server was an awesome IUP grad like myself and was very helpful! 

My chicken nachos were surprisingly flavorful topped with beans, cheese, onions, salsa, sour cream and guacamole, all for $6! My girlfriend ordered the Pittsburgh chicken salad and was the best in town!

I can't possibly say more about Shady Grove. Stop in and find out for yourself!

I have been going to Shadygrove for half off burgers almost every Monday, it's a great deal! Burgers usually come out to around $5 and drafts are around $3. I've had the Shady Grove Burger about 5 times. Quality is a bit inconsistent (can be overcooked sometimes) but is still delicious. Also this place has the best fries I have ever had - crispy outside and soft inside. Only once were the fries done badly (fried in old oil). Wednesday wine night is also fun and has great music! A lot of 90s hip hop. It does get very loud in the upstairs area, so don't expect to have any intimate conversations. They do get busy, so be prepared to wait a bit. Also, skip the tacos, blech. :P

The restaurant was fairly good. The menu is extensive. The food is delightful. The wine list is also impressive. The ambience really makes this place memorable. Whether you want to watch a sporting event or simply enjoy a nice, semi-casual night out--Shady Grove is your spot. The feel is young, contemporary professional rather than rowdy bar or stuffy lounge. If you want to unwind and have a decent time on a weeknight or weekend, this is the place to be; however, it may be too loud for some to enjoy.

Came here for dinner on a Tuesday night and was seated right away. The interior is cute with decorative trees around with lights. We started off with the fried pickles. They were nice and tangy and tasted great with the horseradish sauce. For dinner, I had the southern fried chicken sandwich. The sandwich was huge. I was disappointed that it was not one chicken breast or patty but rather four chicken tenders. This made the sandwich quite difficult to eat. Tenders just kept falling out. The hot sauce was good and added nice flavor, but I ended up just eating some of the tenders on their own. I had ordered waffle fries, but it came with fries. The fries were fine. I could not even finish them, because the food just felt very greasy. My friends had the veggie burger and enjoyed it, but their patties kept falling apart too. Overall, Shady Grove is hit or miss with their dishes.

Wanted to go somewhere I hadn't been before and realized that despite always passing it I have never been.  So I went, and it looked promising from the outside.  Our waitress was attentive and people seemed to be enjoying themselves.  I ordered the Jerk Mahi Mahi on Kaiser and my fiancee ordered the Caprese Sandwich.  This is where things started to fall apart.  
My sandwich came on a hamburger bun, not a Kaiser roll and the fish was mediocre to decent, nothing to write home about, but the jerk rub was not nearly as spicy as a jerk rub should be.  On the menu the Caprese Sandwich is vegetarian and says "Add chicken $3."  The sandwich came with chicken which we did not order, when we asked the waitress she said that it automatically comes with chicken (and therefore also comes automatically for $11 instead of $8), if we didn't want chicken we had to ask to have the sandwich come as it says it does on the menu.  If it automatically comes with chicken, then say that on the menu and charge $11, otherwise, only give us chicken if we ask.
The fries which accompanied our sandwiches were also decent but not great, so in the end, the food was a little on the pricey side for the quality and, more importantly, not consistent with the menu from which we ordered.  All in all, a disappointment.

Visited Shady Grove on a Monday evening. My friend and I both had salads which were huge and very good - the Cobb and the Pittsburgh salad. The people next to us had nachos and an order of latkes - both of these also looked so yum! We weren't in the mood for drinks but their happy hour specials looked pretty good. Definitely worth a visit if you're in Shadyside.

loved it. started off with some sort of cucumber/basil drink.. a little strong on the cucumber, but pretty interesting. then my guests and i shared pretzel bites which were delish. i don't remember which burger i got to be honest, but i do remember thinking it was very good.
the only strange thing about the place is the bathroom... it's upstairs and near impossible to find.
i'd go back for sure, and would like to try several more dishes.

Oh Shady Grove you have improved! Or maybe it's the fact that I'm getting old and hit you up for the early bird special (compared to late night service). Either way the pizza is amazing (try the new shrimp option) and service was on point.

I came here on a mildly busy Tuesday night. My server was VERY wonderful. My mom always asks questions about small trivial things on the menu or something written on the wall about the happy hour, but the server was very helpful and was patient with my mom...which I really appreciate. So much so that when the check came, I looked for the server's name to write a review. Aimee, I really appreciate your service and I wish more servers are as awesome as you are. Thank you!

The food was great, the atmosphere is nice, and the service is top notch. 10/10 would recommend this place.

It's not that bad during their happy hours. The beer deals are pretty good. I tried the yak burger and it was "meh".

The place does get pretty crowded and hence sometimes seating might be an issue. Its just loud enough (so that you don't have to scream at each other) if you aren't in the very back section. The half price wine nights are pretty good too.

Wasn't impressed this time around... 

The mahi tacos were ok, but lacked any type of seasoning on the fish. The Bellini (that is supposed to be one of their popular drinks) wasn't good to me at all. Reminded me of sickening sweet cough syrup...

The service was good, we were always taken care of. Maybe I'll try something else on the menu since the atmosphere is usually very inviting.
Great neighborhood bar, above average food, friendly staff. The shady burger, shoshito peppers and jalapeño popper dip are all awesome !
Awesome food and drinks! Best think had to be the Capri sun because i felt like a kid just with an adult beverage. The servers were excellent. Left full and happy.

The only reason I'm giving this spot 4 stars is because of the spacing. There's outdoor seating too, but I wish there was a little more room inside the building. The food is great, the atmosphere is great, the specials are great, the selection is great, the prices are great. This is one of those rare places in Pittsburgh that is consistently a wonderful experience.

3.5 rounded up to 4
I like this place. Food is good. Service is ok. atmosphere is ok.

Grabbed take out lunch this afternoon around 1pm and had awesome and quick service. My husband got the shady steak wrap, which was full of flavor and better than expected, with waffle fries. It's a cheesesteak and egg wrap. I got the chick Caesar wrap with fries, which was also great. I love their fries and ranch dressing. The mimosas and soup that a lot of people had on their tables looked delicious :) love this spot when we are visiting Shadyside. The atmosphere is comfortable and fun and the food has always been great!

I really like Shady Grove. It's simple, low cost and relaxed. There is even some outdoor seating to people watch Shadyside in the summertime. 
My go to meal is their summer salad. Their salads are huge! You wouldn't leave hungry after their bed of lettuce with delicious toppings. I've had other things like sandwiches but always tend to gravitate toward their salads because they are so big and full of flavor.
They also have fabulous happy hour specials to take advantage of if you care for a beverage. Wine Wednesday is always a hit!
I never ever had an issue with service with my many times visiting. Always friendly and attentive.
Always a go to for a simple meal when in the area. I'm telling you, get that summer salad. It's so good I crave it!

How have I not reviewed Shady Grove yet!?

I have been here so many times, I could not even begin to guess a number. Shady Grove is one of those places that is reliably good--I can't think of anything that I have ever ordered here that I did not like. The menu is large and features a variety of sandwiches (also available as wraps), burgers, pizzas, and HUGE salads. Being a fan of spicy food, some of my personal favorites are the buffalo chicken pizza (self-explanatory) and the Fiero Chicken sandwich (grilled chicken breast, pepper jack cheese, guac, lettuce, tomato, and a spicy habenero sauce). They also have these great crispy french fries which come with the sandwiches. 

They do half-priced bottles of wine on Wednesday nights. I've had both good and bad experiences--it can get REALLY crowded, so if you don't get there early enough you won't get a table. It's kind of awkward when someone in your party has to then carry the wine bottle around.

Bonus points for outdoor seating! Always a good time.
Dope food! Dope service! Dope times! Bee and Liz are excellent employees made the whole experience dope!!
The staff was really jerky. I had the French onion soup. It was incredibly salty. A friend had a burger that was pretty subpar, especially for over $10.

I've only been here once but the one time I came the food was really good! 

I got the southwestern blackened mahi mahi salad and it was delicious! I actually liked it so much that I've recreated it at home and now it's part of my regular cooking rotation. They also serve it in a giant mixing bowl which I thought was odd at first but in the end it just means you get a lot more salad than your average serving! I also got some sweet potato tatter tots which were tasty as well.

It took us some time to get a table (party of 4) since the place is kind of small and the food is not cheap (around $13-15 a dish) but it's definitely worth it every once in a while!

This place is a step up from traditional bar food. It's a great place to grab a cheap bite to eat or drink with friends.  I don't think the wait staff is overly friendly but I have never found them to be rude. Half priced wine nights on Wednesday is usually packed but extremely fun.  This place has a cool special pretty much every night of the week.  Happier staff would've bumped up my rating.
Service and drinks were great! We went on a Thursday night and sat at the bar downstairs. Fabulous drink specials and great bartenders!

It was loud, but a nice atmosphere. The salad I had was served in a giant bowl and would have been perfect if it would have had more than a couple bites of chicken in it. The rest of it was pretty good, though. The server was attentive. The bar made fine drinks. Overall, it was great, except for the seats we had must have been right under the ac vents.

Can you believe I've never been here before?! Crazy, right? Great first experience too!

Our server was the friendliest ever, so that was just the start. I ordered the Veggie Explosion salad and am happy to report it was exactly as advertised! I hate when you get a salad and the toppings are sparse. There were loads of veggies and I especially liked the grilled portobella mushrooms. I thought the balsamic dressing made it a winning combo.

I also ordered the tomato soup, which I believe is always on the menu. It was excellent. I love a nice creamy tomato, and it was just that. I was pleasantly surprised by what a nice lunch it was!

My wife and brother and wife went here again on Saturday after a long bike ride. Once again it didn't disappoint. We sat outside in the little roped off area next to the street. Our waitress was extremely nice and attentive. I ordered a vodka tonic and a side salad and we split the caprese pizza. This is a must try and one of my favorite pizzas. It has garlic, mozzarella, tomato, and basil. It's simple but delicious, It was cooked to perfection in their brick oven. The side salad was large and very tasty. What we like is Shady Grove always has some drink specials. Great food, service, and vibe. This is a must stop in Shadyside.

I used to come here quite often for late-night drinks, but just recently started coming in for lunch. The service is consistent, and they have great salads/pizza/sandwiches, and super yummy fries! Somehow I ended up here 3 times last week (twice for lunch and once for happy hour), so I got a chance to try each of my favorites. My favorites are the Greek salad, BBQ chicken pizza, the Hawaiian pizza, and this week's discovery - the Hot Veggie sandwich.  Really, you can't go wrong with any of the pizzas though. The crust has a sweet flavor to it that really sets it apart from any other pizza in the area. Just thinking about it is making my mouth water...

Shady Grove has good food. They have wraps, salads, and pizzas - and a servicable beer & mix drink menu. It's a good place to go and have a conversation over dinner - not that it's quiet, but I remember having a good conversation every time I've gone there.

After 10 they go 21+ and have cheap pitchers.

The main draw for me to the shady grove is during the summer when you can sit on their patio on a side street just right off of Walnut street. When the weather is nice, we've enjoyed a few nights out there drinking a half priced bottle of wine on Wednesdays. 

We recently went to watch a football game inside and it was enjoyable because it wasn't crowded at all and we got a high top table in the corner where we could hang out and talk for a few hours. The inside is not very big and the bar goes down the middle of the restaurant. The food is okay, however we never think to go there for dinner when we are considering options. They do have a pretty large menu and this past time we ordered the spinach and artichoke dip, and nachos and liked both. 

I'd recommend this place if you're looking for a laid back place and some straight forward American food.

Man, I've been going to Shady Grove since 2008, and it's a place with many of my fond memories. That being said, it's also been a place where I've had some of my worst memories too. Perhaps due to being in college and learning how to frequent bars for the first time. Yikes. 

Beer specials are pretty good here, and wine night back in the day was a pretty big hit. I remember that they would close off Walnut Grill at night, which I thought was strange. They should have all the space available, because it can get super crowded here. The food here is pretty decent. A little more on the expensive side for Pittsburgh, but who am I to complain? The pizzas are all pretty good and the sandwiches are nothing to sniff at. 

Service is pretty spotty, both at the bar and the tables. Bartenders are not generally attentive and the waitstaff is usually short-staffed, so it takes awhile for you to get things like water or other small requests. Also, they're not very friendly, which is disappointing. But, it's never really been enough to ruin anything. Overall, Shady Grove is a decent bar/restaurant with subpar service. If you're looking for a low-key drink or meal during the week, Shady Grove is a solid place for just that.
The staff here are friendly and excellent.  They were very accommodating to our party of 4 with 2 babies.  Their food was average pub fare and priced fairly.  I would return in a pinch.

I came here on Sunday night with about 8 friends to watch the Steelers game. The waitress was very friendly and helpful. The menu had many different options (tacos, sandwiches, hamburgers, salads). I ordered the Shady Burger and it was delicious! I would definitely recommend ordering it. The side of fries were pretty good, but nothing spectacular. 

I'd definitely come back again to try their other hamburgers!
If you want spit in your salad dressing youve ordered from the right place. Bummer I was a fan of them until this meal.
Fun place for burgers (incredibly cheap if you luck into half-price night, which we did). We sat at the bar. Comfortable, fun.
